metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9651 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in CHICKEN 4.9.0.x before 4.9.0.2, 4.9.x before 4.9.1, and before 5.0 allows attackers to have unspecified impact via a positive START argument to the "substring-index[-ci] procedures."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-9651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.10.0-1
libchicken11 - 4.10.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1').
